page.title: 16Communication
page.content: Our group worked on the topic of{ {communication}and we started by looking at old maps. This was because we wanted to find out where the{Post {Office} had been when the centre of Seaton Delaval had been near our school. Our caretaker, Mr. Jacques, could remember when he was a boy playing near it. The Post Office was built on the gable end of Double Row and just outside the door was a slope up to the road. In the winter the boys played on the slope on their sledges and used the counter of the Post Office to stop themselves! The Postmaster,Mr. Gleghorn, was not amused. Today the Post Office is at the Avenue Head and is a sweet shop as well. Of course, our most modern form of Communication is this{computer}and the{videodisc}which will store the new Domesday Book.
